description.narrative:
This project aims to increase the participation of women in social and economic decision making process through increasing their representation in media and advocacy platform. In the short term, women#s media representation is improved in quantity and quality. They will appear more frequently as main characters and in leading, influential positions, and recognised as leaders and owners of social development and economic growth. Besides, civil society organizations and coalitions are committed and able todesign and promotegender responsive actions of advocacy and other interventions
The project will apply two intervention strategies: # Insiders# voice and storytelling: It is essential to raise women#s voice on mass media and social media to gain better public recognition and support for their active participation in decision making. Storytelling has been proven to be a powerful tool in changing human perception and attitudes as it provides both information and emotion. Therefore, storytelling on media will be an important intervention strategy. Women representatives from both urban and rural areas will be facilitated to share their life stories with mass media and write their own posts on social media. By telling informative and touching stories, they will be able to help the public relate to women#s demand on rights and security, realise the need for equality and love in gender relations, and mobilise the support for equal participation of women in the public life. By sharing their own stories, theywill be able to represent the voice of many other women who share their concerns and interests. Women#s stories will also be a key material for public events and social media campaigns.
# Value-based capacity building: To advocate for changes in policyand public attitude toward women#s share in the economic growth, civil society organisations and coalitions should receive both attitudinal and technical support in gender responsiveness. Their capacity must be built to ensure that their programs promotewomen#s rights and security based on values of equality, freedom and love, anddo not fall back to stereotypes and discrimination. The materials and activities conducted will human rights values and principles,and technical tools for applying these valuesin their work.

participating-org.narrative: Institute for Studies of Society, Economy and Environment

The Institute for Studies of Society Economy and Environment (iSEE) was established in 2007. iSEE now has since grown into an organisation with clear vision, mission and defined strategies to support ethnic minorities, LGBT and people who live with HIV in its owndistinctive ways. Its mission: iSEE is a non-profit Vietnamese organisation that commits itself to protecting the human rights of minorities and the socially excluded. Its institutional objectives are to envision a prosperous, diverse, democratic and just Vietnamese society where minorities are treated equally, and where human rights are fulfilled and protected; to aim to becoming a leading think tank in the field of rights of minorities and the socially excluded in Vietnam. Given the current situation of inequality and exclusion and the level of rights denied, iSEE targets its efforts to the following groups: ethnic minorities; lesbian women, gay men, bi-sexual and transgender people; and people living with HIV (focus on ethnic minorities andgay men in the closet).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
